message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a novel adversarial detection method that adaptively learns reasonable metrics to characterize adversarial subspaces. It also uses a model called Neighbor Context Encoder (NCE) to learn from context information and infer if the detected sample is normal or adversarial, which involves machine learning techniques. Additionally, the paper uses datasets commonly used in computer vision (CIFAR-10, CIFAR-100, and ImageNet), which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision). The paper also deals with the security aspect of machine learning, which may place it in the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The use of deep neural networks (DNNs) and the focus on detecting adversarial examples may also suggest that it belongs to the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
